summary: Resolved 3 metadata-only conflicts resulting from a merge of origin/main (which included the fileguard AuditService PR #190) into feature/123-tripwire-cybersecurity-tool-sprint-2-issue-123. All conflicts were in AI-generated metadata files (.claude-output.json, .claude-resolution.json, .conflict-info.json), not in source code. The fileguard AuditService files (fileguard/services/audit.py, fileguard/services/__init__.py, tests/unit/test_audit_service.py, docs/concepts/fileguard/audit.md) merged cleanly as new files.
strategyUsed: For .claude-output.json: kept HEAD (NetworkWatcher PR #188 metadata) since this is the feature/123 branch and HEAD correctly describes the work done in this PR. For .claude-resolution.json: wrote fresh metadata reflecting the current resolution. For .conflict-info.json: the working tree already contained the correctly auto-merged content (PR #188, 3 conflicted metadata files) â€” staged as-is.
